intro: Ruschia marianae, commonly known as the mountain zephyr, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, adapted to store water in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in summer. Ruschia marianae is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
